alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 10:05PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lunenburg, south central Nottoway and northwestern Brunswick Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1004 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rehoboth, or 7 miles southwest of Victoria, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lunenburg around 1010 PM EDT. Victoria around 1020 PM EDT. Kenbridge around 1025 PM EDT. Dundas around 1040 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lafoon Corner, Gary, Bacons Fork, Danieltown, Irby, Wilburn, Gills Corner, Loves Mill, Barrows Store and Murdocks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for south central Virginia.
